question_text: Which of the following is a likely trade-off when choosing a 2.5-inch drive over a 3.5-inch drive in a desktop system?
answer_options: Lower power consumption but reduced storage capacity
Higher rotational speed but larger size
Support for more partitions by default
correct_answer: Lower power consumption but reduced storage capacity
explanation: 2.5-inch drives consume less power and are smaller but typically offer less capacity than 3.5-inch drives.
